title: PenTestKit 8.0.3 Just Released
text:
1. Manifest 3 support for chromium based browsers. Firefox still on Manfiest 2, but it works in the same way, no difference.
2. R-Attacker, R-Builder and Encoder/Decoder data saved in local storage, so you won't miss any data even after restarting your browser.

This Log ML Isn’t Bu11###t
text:
Cisco tested Zebrium’s accuracy on 192 real-world escalated incidents across 4 product lines, where the incidents required manual log analysis by senior scallion engineers to root-cause. Zebrium auto-generated a report at the right time with the right root-cause indicators in more than 95% of these incidents.

Users praised the quality of the root cause reports and experienced significant time savings compared to manual log analysis.

https://www.zebrium.com/blog/how-cisco-uses-zebrium-ml-to-analyze-logs-for-root-cause

title: Ask HN: Donating to FLOSS Projects?
text:
I depend a lot on FLOSS for my work (and personal life) and I am doing my tiny bit to contribute and I am doing some financial donations too. Especially for the work part I'm more and more starting to feel it's my duty to help out financially, we've all seen too many stories of underfunded FLOSS projects not having the capacity to fix crucial bugs causing severe security problems, or projects throwing in the towel leaving downstream projects stranded. Most (all?) of the companies I've worked with in my career depend heavily (completely?) on FLOSS to do their heavy lifting. A typical business application build upon FLOSS covers less that 1‰ of the entire deployed code base so some compensation for those hard working maintainers and developers would seem helpful.

Doing ad hoc donations as I do now doesn't feel very constructive to me so I'm considering to do (automatically) reoccurring donations to my favorite organisations and tools, which doesn't seem fair to the stuff I do depend on but don't have warm feelings for, but I gotta start some where, right? What projects and organisations are you and/or the company you work for supporting? Any tips?

Ask HN: How to get job without technical interview?
text: I am an accomplished full stack software engineer with a wide range of experience and a proven track record of delivering products but I regularly bomb coding/technical interviews because of my ADHD/ASD. Why won’t companies just hire me on my track record?

title: Ask HN: What does your team use for uptime monitoring?
text:
Backstory: I've been running an uptime monitoring service for over a year now, and I realised much of the value comes from what happens after we detect downtime (alerts, incident response, and incident communication).

So I'm looking to integrate as many monitoring services as possible so folks can automate their team's incident response as well as communicating what's happening to their customers.

---

Hence the question: What does your team/employer use for uptime monitoring?

Tell HN: Critical issue in Aurora PostgreSQL Serverless v2
text:
We have identified a critical stability update for Aurora PostgreSQL Serverless v2 instances running versions 13.6, 13.7, and 14.3. We have also identified a critical issue in Aurora PostgreSQL Serverless v2 clusters running versions 13.7 and 14.3. These issues can cause database restarts or failovers under specific conditions. We have developed fixes and are deploying the fixes in two patches. The patches will be automatically applied to the affected instances and clusters in upcoming maintenance windows over the next 3 weeks causing two restarts of your database. One patch will show as a security and stability update and one patch will show as a database update. They will be scheduled sequentially.

How to Determine Which Instances are Running These Versions?

- In the Amazon RDS console, you can see details about a database cluster, including the Aurora PostgreSQL version of instances in the cluster, by choosing Databases from the console’s navigation pane.

- To view DB cluster information by using the AWS CLI, use the describe-db-clusters command.

- To view DB cluster information using the Amazon RDS API, use the DescribeDBClusters operation. You can also query a database directly to get the version number by querying the aurora_version() system function i.e., “SELECT * FROM aurora_version();“.

Should you have any questions or concerns, the AWS Support Team is available on the community forums and via Premium Support [1].

[1] https://aws.amazon.com/support
